page.title: 04THE HUNTING LODGE,COTTINGHAM
page.content: The 16th Century Hunting Lodge and the adjoining Bury House were the home of the Masters of the local hunt and housed its hounds and horses. About 20 years ago the Hunting Lodge was converted into a Restaurant. The old hay barn is now the entrance hall and the former stables and hay loft are now the Restaurant and Lounge Bar. The original stable hitching rings can still be seen in the walls. Bury House itself has now been converted into residential flats. Some links with the past still remain. Thwarted in love, the Ghost of Thomas Medlicote, Head Groom in the 1780's, is said to walk the old stables at night. The sound of hooves can be heard as he leads his horse to a rope tied to the rafters where he hung himself.
